sentence.text: The aim of the present study is to evaluate protein acetylation (negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II, negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II and negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II) and clock-controlled (vascular endothelial growth factor-a, early growth response protein 1 and estrogen receptor b) gene expression in colorectal cancer and adjacent tissue and identify a possible link between survival of patients and expression of above mentioned genes.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: RNA was extracted from the tumor tissue and adjacent parts of the resected colon, and real-time PCR was used for detection of protein acetylation gene expression.

Expression of negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II and negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II was significantly downregulated in tumor tissue compared to adjacent tissues.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: Moreover, we observed an increase in negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II expression in female patients with distant metastases in tumor compared to adjacent tissue.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: Accordingly, women with high expression of negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II in tumor tissue displayed worse survival, which was not observed in men.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: Taken together, expression of protein acetylation and clock-controlled genes in tumors of males and females clustered according to presence of distant metastases correlated with survival analysis.
Low expression of negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II-a in tumor correlated with better survival in men but not in women.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: Our data indicate sex-dependent associations between protein acetylation and clock-controlled gene expression in cancer tissue and patient*s survival prognosis
